page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content:
Liphook is a large village situated north east of Petersfield. The A3 London-Portsmouth main road runs through it. The Waterloo-Portsmouth railway line also runs through Liphook.
Historically, Liphood is famous for the Royal Anchor Hotel. The Ancher is a famous late 17th century posting inn. Many well-known people have stayed there, including Queen Victoria, General Blucher and Nelson
In the modern day, Liphook is known as being next to Longmoor Camp; a military training camp. Early in 1985 a cruise missile was transported to Longmoor camp and peace protestors demonstrated outside.
